articles.title: Introduction to Project Mariner
articles.content:
# Introduction to Project Mariner

Welcome to Project Mariner, an enterprise-grade AI platform designed to enhance your research and productivity. This article provides an overview of the platform's capabilities and how to get started.

## What is Project Mariner?

Project Mariner is an AI-powered platform that combines advanced language models with specialized tools for research, documentation, and education. It offers a user-friendly interface for interacting with AI models and accessing curated content.

## Key Features

- AI-powered chat interface
- Comprehensive documentation
- Research labs for experimentation
- Educational resources
- Specialized AI agents

## Getting Started

To begin using Project Mariner, simply create an account and explore the different sections of the platform. The AI chat feature is a great place to start asking questions and getting familiar with the system's capabilities.
articles.summary: An introduction to the Project Mariner platform and its key features

articles.title: Using the AI Chat Interface
articles.content:
# Using the AI Chat Interface

The AI chat interface is one of the core features of Project Mariner. This guide explains how to get the most out of your interactions with the AI assistant.

## Starting a Conversation

To start a conversation, navigate to the Chat section and type your question or prompt in the input field at the bottom of the screen. The AI will respond based on its training and the context of your conversation.

## Selecting AI Models

Project Mariner offers several AI models with different capabilities:

- GPT-4: Most capable model for complex tasks
- GPT-3.5: Fast and efficient for most queries
- Claude: Specialized for investment analysis
- Internal LLM: Trained on company data

Select the appropriate model from the dropdown menu based on your needs.

## Best Practices

- Be specific in your queries
- Provide context when needed
- Use follow-up questions to clarify responses
- Save important conversations for future reference
articles.summary: How to use the AI chat interface and get the most out of your conversations

articles.title: API Integration Guide
articles.content:
# API Integration Guide

This guide explains how to integrate your applications with the Project Mariner API.

## Authentication

All API requests require authentication using JWT tokens. To obtain a token, make a POST request to the `/api/v1/auth/login` endpoint with your credentials.

```json
{
  "email": "your.email@example.com",
  "password": "your-password"
}
```

The response will include an access token and a refresh token:

```json
{
  "accessToken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR...",
  "refreshToken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsIn...",
  "user": {
    "id": "user-id",
    "email": "your.email@example.com",
    "firstName": "Your",
    "lastName": "Name",
    "role": "user"
  }
}
```

Include the access token in the Authorization header for all subsequent requests:

```
Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR...
```

## Making API Requests

The API follows RESTful conventions. Resources are accessed via standard HTTP methods:

- GET: Retrieve resources
- POST: Create new resources
- PUT: Update existing resources
- DELETE: Remove resources

Responses are returned in JSON format with appropriate HTTP status codes.

## Error Handling

Errors are returned with appropriate HTTP status codes and a JSON body containing error details:

```json
{
  "code": "ERROR_CODE",
  "message": "Descriptive error message"
}
```

Common error codes include:

- 400: Bad Request
- 401: Unauthorized
- 403: Forbidden
- 404: Not Found
- 422: Validation Error
- 500: Internal Server Error
articles.summary: Guide for integrating with the Project Mariner API
